item.title: Loops and User Input
item.description: In this session we explore loops in more depth and introduce new inputs. Different types of inputs allow for us to interact with the user in more ways.

item.title: Lists and an Introduction to Loops
item.description: This session introduces lists and loops. Lists store multiple values while loops repeat a section of code a certain number of times.

item.title: Collaboration with Information Security Club
item.description: We are excited for our collaboration with the Information Security Club which will be happening in the last week of November!

item.title: Follow us on Instagram!
item.description: Whether you are a Schulich Ignite mentee or not, make sure to follow our Instagram @schulichignite to see some cool weekly challenges and coding tips!

item.title: If-Statements and Logical Operators
item.description: In this session we will focus on if/else statements as well as logical and relational operators. These operators are used in if/else statements to apply limits and restraints to our code.

item.title: Operators and Making Objects Move
item.description: In this session we will build on the types and uses of variables and arithmetic operators. Proper variable and operator use is crucial to the simplicity and maintainability of our code.

item.title: Start of Sessions!
item.description: Today marks the start of the 2020 Fall sessions. We are excited to meet all of you and see how your coding skills progress over the upcoming 8 weeks!

item.title: Introduction to Python
item.description: In this session we will give an intro to the coding platform we use and the basics of python. These basics will be the fundamental building blocks of all of our code!

item.title: Summer 2020 Gala
item.description: Schulich Ignite celebrated the end of our summer sessions with a Gala! At the Gala, students had the chance to showcase the projects that they have been working on for the past two weeks to mentors and friends.
My name is Anmol Ahuja and I am the President at Schulich Ignite. I am responsible for managing the club, but most importantly, being a mentor.
Hello my name is Ayush Chaudhari and I am the current VP Logistics of Schulich Ignite. I work behind the scenes to ensure everything runs smoothly and efficiently.
description
Hi! I’m Emily Knight and I am the Junior President of Schulich Ignite. I help out with club management and lead the lectures for some of our sessions.

My name is Mohanad Ibrahiem and I am the VP Communications at Schulich Ignite. I am responsible for contacting high schools, sponsors, organizations, team members and managing the club’s social media.

My name is Pooja Veedu and I am a Social Media Commissioner for Schulich Ignite. I am responsible for growing the club’s social media presence by managing the Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn and Tiktok pages.
My name is Radu Schirliu, and I am the VP of Content Development for Schulich Ignite. I am responsible for creating all of the teaching materials and examples that are used during the sessions.
My name is Rajpreet Gill and I am the VP Events at Schulich Ignite. I am responsible for planning, managing, and executing events.
description
My name is Vic Phan, and I am the VP Finance at Schulich Ignite. On top of being a mentor, I am also in charge of buying food and supplies, creating the budget, and managing the club’s finances.
Fall sessions will take place online through Zoom, and our platform will be used to code with ease. A mentor will still be assigned 2-4 mentees, and we will have breakout rooms for collaboration.
Yes! If you would like to be grouped with your friends who are also joining the program, simply list their names in the sign up survey, and we will do the rest!

Through the Schulich Ignite program, you will be able to develop basic coding skills, along with problem-solving skills. Our lectures will teach you how to think outside of the box when solving complex coding problems.
To make coding easily accessible to students, we have a platform where you can code without downloading anything! To access it, please visit the website https://ignite.
This program is directed towards high school students in grades 9-12 who are inexperienced with coding but are looking to start learning its basics.
